segment: Privacy Policy   TED encourages our community to discover and share ideas with one another. While gathering information about the people who use the site is an important part of the TED.com experience, we take your privacy very seriously, and make every effort to safeguard your personal data. This privacy policy is intended to inform you of what information we collect, how this information is used, and what steps we take to protect this information. If you have any questions or concerns about our privacy policy and protections, please contact us.

model_analysis.explanation: This segment provides a general introduction to the privacy policy, highlighting the importance of user privacy and offering contact information for questions or concerns.

segment: What information do we collect?   We collect two kinds of information: Personal information that you directly provide to us, which includes information you supply when you register an account with us.  Automatically collected, non-personal information, which includes tracking information gathered as you use TED.com.

model_analysis.explanation: The policy segment indicates the collection of personal information provided directly by users when registering, which is identifiable and collected explicitly for basic service features. Additionally, non-personal information is automatically collected during website use.

segment: We may use this information to help customize your TED.com experience based on your previous activities on TED.com.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the information is used to customize the user's experience based on their previous activities, which falls under personalization/customization.

segment: Information you provide directly to us:   When you register an account on TED.com, we ask you to provide a unique email address, first and last name, and password. You have the option of also providing profile information (such as location, occupation and your personal story). You may also choose to directly send us information such as email correspondence or search queries.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of identifiable personal information such as email, name, and optional profile details during account registration on TED.com. The collection is explicit and opt-in, as users provide this information directly.

segment: You may choose to create a TED.com account using the Facebook Connect feature on TED.com. By doing this, you are asking Facebook to send us certain information from your Facebook profile, and you authorize us to collect, store and use in accordance with this privacy policy any and all information available to us through the Facebook interface.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of user information from Facebook when the user connects their TED.com account using Facebook Connect, which involves receiving data from a named third-party service.

segment: Billing and credit card information:   When required for TED Conference registration or other services, we may request and store name, address, telephone number, email address and billing information. We do not store credit card numbers except for the last 4 digits. This information will only be shared with third parties who perform tasks required to complete the purchase transaction.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of billing and credit card information for conference registration and services. It specifies that the information is identifiable and collected explicitly for completing transactions, which aligns with basic service/feature purposes.

segment: Comments, conversations and other public activities:   We offer you opportunities to engage in public activities on TED.com. "Public activities" are any actions you take that are designed to be visible to other users, including comments, conversations, recommendations and ratings. If you choose to engage in public activities, you should be aware that any personal information you submit there can be read, collected or used by other users of these areas, and could be used to send you unsolicited messages.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses how personal information submitted in public activities can be read, collected, or used by other users, indicating sharing with third parties.

segment: We are not responsible for the personally identifiable information you choose to submit in these forums, and we have no responsibility to publish, remove or edit any of your comments, conversations or other content. For more information, see the TED.com Terms of Use.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment disclaims responsibility for user-submitted content in forums, indicating a practice not covered by their privacy obligations.

segment: When you share or recommend any TED.com content using your Facebook profile, your action is governed by Facebook's privacy policy. Likewise, when you share or recommend any TED.com content through other social media outlets, your actions are governed by their privacy policies.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes how sharing TED.com content on social media is subject to the privacy policies of those third-party platforms, indicating that the information is shared with these entities.

segment: Information gathered automatically:   We use various technologies to manage TED.com and track use of the content we provide, including: the IP address used when registering and submitting content to the site  standard web analytics information  aggregated data about email click-through rates and video viewing  information collected through HTML cookies, Flash cookies, web beacons, and similar technologies.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the automatic collection of information using technologies like cookies and web beacons on the website, which is used for analytics and tracking purposes. The information includes IP addresses and standard web analytics, indicating identifiable data collection.

segment: Non-personal information that we collect using these technologies may be combined with information you provide directly to us.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that non-personal information collected through certain technologies may be combined with information provided directly by the user, suggesting collection on the website.

segment: Device information:   We may collect non-personal information about the computer, mobile device or other device you use to access TED services, such as IP address, geolocation information, unique device identifiers, browser type, browser language and other transactional information.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the collection of device-related information such as IP address and unique device identifiers when accessing services, which is identifiable and likely used for service operation and security purposes.

segment: This information may be used to offer you optimized TED.com experiences based on your device or location.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment indicates that the information is used to offer optimized experiences, which suggests personalization/customization based on device or location.

segment: How we use the information we gather:   Providing requested services:   We may use the information that we collect to fulfill your requests for services and information. For example, we may use your contact information to respond to your customer service requests, or to enable registration for one of our conferences.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment explains that the information collected is used to fulfill user requests for services and information, such as responding to customer service requests and enabling conference registration, which falls under basic service/feature purposes.

segment: E-mail and newsletters:   If you signed up for one of our email newsletters, we will send you the newsletter that you requested. We may also use the information that we collect to send you other e-mail communications, such as information about your account, changes to the site, or information about our conferences and events (if you have opted in for this information.)

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes collecting contact information on the website for sending newsletters and other communications, requiring users to opt-in, indicating explicit consent for marketing purposes.

segment: Statistical analysis:   We perform statistical analyses of users of the site, and their viewing and participation patterns, for product development purposes and to generally inform advertisers about the nature of our audience. Please note that we do not share contact information with our advertisers.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the use of statistical analysis for understanding user patterns and informing advertisers, which falls under analytics/research purposes.

segment: Third parties:   We may employ third parties to perform site-related services, including database management, maintenance services, analytics, marketing, billing and email distribution. These third parties have access to your information only to perform these tasks on our behalf.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes sharing information with third parties for site-related services such as database management and marketing, indicating 'Receive/Shared with' as the action. The third parties are unnamed, and the purpose aligns with 'Service operation and security'. The specific types of personal information shared are not specified.

segment: Enforcement:   We may use the information that we collect to prevent illegal activities, to enforce the TED.com Terms of Use, or as otherwise required by law.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes using collected information to prevent illegal activities and enforce terms, which aligns with the purpose of service operation and security.

segment: In addition to the uses identified above, we may use the information that we collect for any other purposes disclosed to you at the time we collect your information or pursuant to your consent.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment mentions using collected information for other purposes disclosed at the time of collection or with user consent, indicating an unspecified or additional purpose beyond those already identified.

segment: Please note that third parties may independently collect data about you, including your IP address and information about the websites you visit and the links you click, through cookies, clicks on links, or other means when you visit or view ads on the site. We do not control the privacy practices of these third-party services.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses third parties collecting data such as IP addresses and user activities on the site through cookies and links. It specifies that these are third-party actions, not controlled by the first party, fitting the 'Collect on first party website/app' action.

segment: Protection of your information:   To prevent unauthorized access, maintain data accuracy and ensure the appropriate use of information, we have put in place commercially reasonable physical, technical and administrative controls to protect your information. Please note that no method of transmission over the internet is 100% secure.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment describes the implementation of physical, technical, and administrative controls to protect user information, which aligns with generic data security measures.

segment: Children under the age of 13:

model_analysis.explanation: The segment refers to a specific audience, namely children under the age of 13, which indicates a focus on privacy considerations for this age group.

segment: We do not knowingly collect personal information from children under 13. If we learn that we have collected any personal information from a child under the age of 13 without verifiable parental consent, we will delete that information from our database as quickly as possible. If you believe that we may have collected information from a child under 13, please contact us.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment addresses the collection of personal information from children under 13, indicating compliance with privacy laws regarding children's data.

segment: Changes to this privacy policy:   This privacy policy may be amended from time to time. Any such changes will be posted on this page. We will notify you of any significant or material changes in the way we treat your information by placing a prominent notice on our site or sending a notice to the primary email address specified in your account.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment discusses changes to the privacy policy and specifies that significant changes will be notified on the website or via email, indicating a privacy relevant change and general notice on the website.

segment: Deleting your account:   You can request that your account be deleted at any time by contacting us. When your account is deleted, your user profile and all public activities (comments, conversation topics) will be removed. To unsubscribe from our newsletters, click on the link at the bottom of a newsletter you have received, or you can manage your subscriptions from your TED.com profile.

model_analysis.explanation: The segment explains how a user can delete their account, which includes the removal of their user profile and public activities. This falls under the 'Delete account (full)' access type.
